intro: Gentiana strictiflora, commonly known as the upright gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It features striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. The plant has a slender, upright stem that supports its dense clusters of small, showy flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, contributing to its elegant appearance. Gentiana strictiflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and woodland edges.
